timeline.bodyText: If this is now a hardcoded list that never changes, then please move it to a static final field.
timeline.author: rnveach

timeline.bodyText: Please also add a UT with issue but where it will produce a violation to show check functionality still works in this situation, if there is not one already.
timeline.author: rnveach

replies.bodyText: The file I am passing to verify does have two violations, but they are from SummaryJavadoc.  Should I add some code to trigger violations from MissingDeprecatedCheck, i.e. annotation/messages.properties?
replies.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText:
Should I add some code to trigger violations from MissingDeprecatedCheck

Yes, this is what I am looking for. This test is only for MissingDeprecatedCheck so all examples should focus around it. This is what is being reported to us in issue. Your change looks good from just reading source, but I wanted to make sure it doesn't impact logic to produce a violation.
replies.author: rnveach

replies.bodyText:
Please let me know if there's any other checks I should add, it didn't seem like any others would apply to packages in MissingDeprecatedCheck.
Edit: I should add a check for annotation.package.location shouldn't I?
replies.author: nmancus1

timeline.bodyText: please use Set collection for quicker search.
timeline.author: romani

timeline.bodyText: I might miss something, this update is just code refactoring, and not related to functional fix. If so , please move to searate comit of the same PR, commit with prefix "minor".
timeline.author: romani

replies.bodyText: This was done to reduce cyclomatic complexity (11) reported by mvn clean verify.
replies.author: nmancus1

replies.bodyText: So it is unrelated to functional fix and fortunately not mixed with other update, please move it to separate commit with message minor: reduce cyclomatic complexity before next update
replies.author: romani

timeline.message: minor: reduce cyclomatic complexity before next update
